div.p: Barr Smith Library, University of Adelaide, SA.

This day, dear Prof Tate, I got a letter from Mr Thiselton-Dyer,
Letter not found; but see M to W. Thiselton-Dyer, 10 January 1884 (in this edition as 84-10-01a). the Assistant Director of Kew, urging that some leading specialist in Geology should take particularly charge of your Candidature at the R.S. Please write at once to your geologic friends to cooperate with Mr Dyer in your interest.
As finally lodged, Tate's nomination certificate at the Royal Society of London included, in addition to the signatures of his Australian and NZ sponsors (M, James Hector, Julius Haast, Frederick McCoy, Robert Ellery and George Verdon), those of Sir Henry Barkly, the botanists Daniel Oliver and J. G. Baker, and the palaeontologists Robert Etheridge Sr and H. B. Woodward. He requested me, on the suggestion of Prof Mich Foster,
Michael Foster, Secretary of the Royal Society of London at the time. to write out special notes in reference to your researches, which I have done forthwith.
